UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS
URBANA, ILLINOIS
RADIO STATION WILL
August 4, 1952
Mr. Seymour N. Siegel
President, NAEB
WNYC, Municipal Broadcasting System
2500 Municipal Building
New York 7, New York
Dear Sy:
Your carbons arriving today break my back, and my
heart. I feel for you.
Enclosed, highly condensed but up-to-date treasurer
report. There*s been little doing financially, so there has been
little change reflected in reports. I apologize, sir, for being
so derelict in my duties. It isn't the little things, it's the
little things added together that get me down.
In my absence,mail coming here will be handled. My very
efficient secretary, Pern Hartz, will handle what needs to be done,
and will check with Jim on any questionable matters.
My summer address, August 7 - September 7, Box 234,
Deltaville, Virginia. And, I cannot be reached by phone, and
telegrams are worse. Sir, I shall not be at Ames.
For what my comments are worth, re. Goldschmidt series.
I still think N0vember release better, but will hold no personal
brief if starting date is changed and people advised pronto. Our
September and October printed programs have gone to press.
Also, I have no objections to discs. I have objections
to failures in making decisions, and forever delaying things. That
is the only reason I moved for action in meeting at Battle Creek.
And, here months later people are still talking about changing or
doing something else. The Board was present and acted. I say
this without malice. I say again, personally changes may be made,
but if made, we ought to get 'em made and quit making changes.
